com.herocraftonline.heroes.characters.skill

Class ActiveSkill

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.herocraftonline.heroes.command.BasicCommand
      • com.herocraftonline.heroes.characters.skill.Skill
        • com.herocraftonline.heroes.characters.skill.ActiveSkill
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SkillArrowstorm, SkillAssassinsBlade, SkillBlink, SkillDespair, SkillDisenchant, SkillEscapeArtist, SkillExcavate, SkillFireArrow, SkillFireball, SkillGills, SkillGroupHeal, SkillGuardianAngel, SkillIceArrow, SkillIcebolt, SkillInvuln, SkillJump, SkillLight, SkillMark, SkillMight, SkillOne, SkillPoisonArrow, SkillPort, SkillRecall, SkillRepair, SkillSafefall, SkillSmoke, SkillSneak, SkillSonicBoom, SkillSummonArrow, SkillSummonChicken, SkillSummonCow, SkillSummonfood, SkillSummonMooshroomCow, SkillSummonPig, SkillSummonSheep, SkillSuperheat, SkillSuperJump, SkillTaunt, SkillTelekinesis, SkillWisdom, TargettedSkill

    public abstract class ActiveSkill
extends Skill
    A skill that performs an action in direct response to a user command. All skill identifiers must begin with skill, e.g. "skill fireball", in order to be recognized. ActiveSkills define four default settings: mana, cooldown, experience and usage text. Mana is deducted and a cooldown is activated when the use method returns true. The execute automatically handles class, level, mana and cooldown checks on a player attempting to use a skill and should not be overridden. If all of these checks pass, the use method is called, which should contain the heart of the skill's behavior that is unique to each skill.

    Skill Framework:
    • ActiveSkill
      • ActiveEffectSkill
      • TargettedSkill
    • PassiveSkill
    • OutsourcedSkill

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public boolean execute(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
              String identifier,
              String[] args)
        Called whenever a command with an identifier registered to this skill is used. This implementation performs all necessary class, level, mana and cooldown checks. This method should not be overridden unless you really know what you're doing. If all checks pass, this method calls use. If use returns true, this method automatically deducts mana, awards experience and sets a cooldown.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Command
        Specified by:
        execute in class Skill
        Parameters:
        sender - the CommandSender issuing the command
        args - the arguments provided with the command

      • getDefaultConfig

        public org.bukkit.configuration.ConfigurationSection getDefaultConfig()
        Creates and returns a ConfigurationNode containing the default usage text. When using additional configuration settings in your skills, be sure to override this method to define them with defaults.
        Overrides:
        getDefaultConfig in class Skill
        Returns:
        a default configuration

      • getDelayText

        public String getDelayText()
        Returns the text to be displayed when the skill is warming up. This text is pulled from the #SETTING_DELAYTEXT entry in the skill's configuration during initialization.
        Returns:
        the usage text

      • getUseText

        public String getUseText()
        Returns the text to be displayed when the skill is successfully used. This text is pulled from the #SETTING_USETEXT entry in the skill's configuration during initialization.
        Returns:
        the usage text

      • init

        public void init()
        Loads and stores the skill's usage text from the configuration. By default, this text is "%hero% used %skill%!" where %hero% and %skill% are replaced with the Hero's and skill's names, respectively.
        Specified by:
        init in class Skill

      • setDelayText

        public void setDelayText(String delayText)
        Changes the stored delay skill usage text. This can be used to override the message found in the skill's configuration.
        Parameters:
        delayText - the new delayed skill usage text

      • setUseText

        public void setUseText(String useText)
        Changes the stored usage text. This can be used to override the message found in the skill's configuration.
        Parameters:
        useText - the new usage text

      • use

        public abstract SkillResult use(Hero hero,
              String[] args)
        The heart of any ActiveSkill, this method defines what actually happens when the skill is used. See execute for a brief explanation of the execution process.
        Parameters:
        hero - the Hero using the skill
        args - the arguments provided with the command
        Returns:
        SkillResult if skill completed normally, or with an execution error
